name: GentleMax Pro Plus

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Latest generation GentleMax. Larger spot sizes (up to 26mm), higher energy, faster repetition rates than the GentleMax Pro.

richContent.overview: Candela's most powerful dual-wavelength system. Successor to the GentleMax Pro with larger spot sizes, higher energy output, and faster treatment speeds.
richContent.howItWorks: Same dual-wavelength approach (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG) with DCD cooling. Spot sizes up to 26mm and higher energy levels allow faster, more effective treatments than the Pro.
typicalUses: All body areas and Fitzpatrick I-VI
Clinics upgrading from GentleMax Pro for faster throughput
richContent.keyFeatures: Spot sizes up to 26mm (vs 24mm on the Pro). Higher energy output for more effective treatment of coarse or resistant hair. The most expensive purpose-built hair removal laser on the market.

name: GentleMax Pro

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG. Gold standard for versatility. Dynamic Cooling Device (DCD) provides cryogen spray before each pulse.

richContent.overview: Candela's dual-wavelength system combining 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG. One of the most widely used professional hair removal lasers worldwide.
richContent.howItWorks: The 755nm targets melanin effectively in lighter skin, while the 1064nm penetrates deeper for darker skin tones. The patented Dynamic Cooling Device (DCD) sprays cryogen milliseconds before each pulse, protecting the skin while the laser reaches hair follicles.
typicalUses: Permanent hair reduction on all body areas
Full Fitzpatrick I-VI range with wavelength switching
richContent.keyFeatures: Adjustable spot sizes up to 24mm for fast treatment of large areas. The DCD cooling significantly reduces discomfort compared to contact cooling methods.

name: GentleMax

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Predecessor to GentleMax Pro. Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG.

richContent.overview: Candela's original dual-wavelength system. Predecessor to the GentleMax Pro. Still widely used in clinics.
richContent.howItWorks: Same dual-wavelength approach as the GentleMax Pro (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG) with DCD cryogen cooling. Practitioners switch wavelengths based on patient skin type.
typicalUses: Hair removal across all body areas and skin types
Clinics often run it alongside newer equipment
richContent.keyFeatures: Pioneered the dual-wavelength approach that became the industry standard. Same DCD cooling as newer models.

name: GentleLase

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium skin tones (Alexandrite wavelength)

notes: 755nm Alexandrite only. Excellent for lighter skin tones with dark hair.

richContent.overview: Candela's dedicated 755nm Alexandrite laser, optimized for hair removal on lighter skin types (Fitzpatrick I-IV) with dark hair.
richContent.howItWorks: The 755nm wavelength is highly absorbed by melanin, making it extremely effective at disabling hair follicles. DCD cryogen spray protects surrounding skin before each pulse.
typicalUses: Fair to medium skin with dark hair
All body areas: face, underarms, bikini, legs, arms
richContent.keyFeatures: Fastest treatment times among laser types for appropriate skin tones due to superior melanin absorption at 755nm.

name: GentleLase Pro

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium skin tones (Alexandrite wavelength)

notes: Updated GentleLase with larger spot sizes and faster repetition rates.

richContent.overview: Enhanced version of Candela's Alexandrite laser with improved speed and larger spot sizes.
richContent.howItWorks: Same 755nm Alexandrite technology as the GentleLase with faster repetition rates and DCD cooling.
typicalUses: Large body areas (full legs, back, chest) treated faster than original GentleLase
Also effective for smaller precision areas
richContent.keyFeatures: Spot sizes up to 24mm. Full leg treatments in under 30 minutes.

name: GentleYAG

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones, especially effective for darker skin (Nd:YAG wavelength)

notes: 1064nm Nd:YAG only. Safe for darker skin tones where Alexandrite cannot be used.

richContent.overview: Candela's dedicated 1064nm Nd:YAG laser, designed specifically for safe hair removal on darker skin types (Fitzpatrick V-VI).
richContent.howItWorks: The 1064nm wavelength penetrates deeper and is less absorbed by epidermal melanin, allowing it to reach follicles without overheating darker skin. DCD cooling adds an extra layer of protection.
typicalUses: Darker skin tones that cannot safely use Alexandrite or diode lasers
Also used on tanned patients
richContent.keyFeatures: Fills a critical need for clinics serving diverse populations. Deeper penetration also effective for coarser hair.

name: Nordlys

skinTypes.displayText: Varies by handpiece attachment

notes: Multi-application platform (formerly Ellipse). Hair removal is one of many applications. Not purpose-built for hair removal.

richContent.overview: Candela's multi-application aesthetic platform (formerly Ellipse). Hair removal is one of many capabilities, not its primary focus.
richContent.howItWorks: Supports multiple handpiece attachments. For hair removal, it uses Alexandrite or Nd:YAG depending on the handpiece selected. Uses contact cooling rather than the DCD system found in the Gentle series.
typicalUses: Clinics offering diverse treatment menus (rosacea, sun damage, skin tightening) alongside hair removal
richContent.keyFeatures: Versatile across many treatments, but dedicated hair removal devices like the Gentle series may deliver better results for that specific application.

name: Vectus

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: 810nm diode laser with Skintel melanin reader for personalized settings. Large spot size for fast treatment.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's premium 810nm diode laser with the largest spot size available in a diode system. Built for high-volume clinics.
richContent.howItWorks: The Skintel melanin reader measures patient skin type objectively to recommend settings, rather than relying on visual assessment. Sapphire contact cooling protects the skin.
typicalUses: Fast treatment of large body areas (back, chest, legs)
High-volume practices where speed matters
richContent.keyFeatures: Skintel melanin reader removes guesswork from parameter selection. Large spot size significantly reduces treatment time.

name: Apogee Elite

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's dual-wavelength system (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG).
richContent.howItWorks: Practitioners select wavelength based on skin type. Both can be used in the same session. SmartCool air cooling protects the skin before, during, and after each pulse.
typicalUses: All body areas and Fitzpatrick I-VI
richContent.keyFeatures: Proven dual-wavelength platform with SmartCool integrated air cooling system.

name: Elite+

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG. Predecessor to Elite iQ.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's dual-wavelength system (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG). Predecessor to the Elite iQ.
richContent.howItWorks: Practitioners select wavelength based on skin type. Both can be used in the same session. Sapphire contact cooling protects the epidermis.
typicalUses: All body areas and Fitzpatrick I-VI
Clinics with diverse patient populations
richContent.keyFeatures: Proven dual-wavelength technology. Many clinics still run Elite+ systems alongside newer equipment due to their reliability.

name: Elite iQ

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Latest generation dual-wavelength laser from Cynosure. Skintel melanin reader for customized settings.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's latest dual-wavelength system with Skintel melanin reader for objective skin type measurement.
richContent.howItWorks: Skintel reads skin melanin content and recommends wavelength and parameters. Both 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG available. Enhanced contact cooling.
typicalUses: All body areas and skin types
Useful for training new practitioners. Skintel guides parameter selection
richContent.keyFeatures: Skintel integration removes guesswork. Larger spot sizes and faster repetition rates than the Elite+.

name: Icon

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength)

notes: Multi-application aesthetic platform. Hair removal is one of many treatments available. Not purpose-built for hair removal.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's multi-application platform. Hair removal is one of many capabilities, not its primary purpose.
richContent.howItWorks: Uses 1064nm Nd:YAG for hair removal. Supports multiple handpieces for other treatments (photofacials, scar treatment, skin resurfacing). Contact cooling protects skin.
typicalUses: Practices offering comprehensive aesthetic services beyond just hair removal
richContent.keyFeatures: Versatile platform, but may not match dedicated hair removal systems for efficiency. Safe for darker skin types via the 1064nm wavelength.

name: LightSheer

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: Original 810nm diode laser. Industry standard for diode technology.

richContent.overview: Lumenis's original 810nm diode laser that established the standard for diode hair removal. Proven over decades of clinical use.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm wavelength targets melanin in follicles while contact cooling protects the skin. Adjustable pulse duration and fluence for different hair types and skin tones.
typicalUses: All body areas for Fitzpatrick I-V
The workhorse of many established practices
richContent.keyFeatures: One of the longest clinical track records of any hair removal laser. Well-documented safety profile.

name: LightSheer Duet

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: Features vacuum-assisted high-speed handpiece for large areas and standard handpiece for precision work.

richContent.overview: Lumenis's dual-handpiece diode laser featuring vacuum-assisted technology for dramatically faster treatments.
richContent.howItWorks: Two handpieces: a large vacuum-assisted one (HS) for rapid coverage and a standard one (ET) for precision. The vacuum draws skin into the treatment window, bringing follicles closer to the laser and allowing effective treatment at lower, and less painful, fluences.
typicalUses: HS handpiece: backs, legs, chests in under 15 minutes
ET handpiece: face, bikini, underarms
richContent.keyFeatures: Vacuum-assisted technology means faster treatments with less pain. No compromise on efficacy.

name: LightSheer Desire

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: Enhanced version with improved ergonomics and treatment speed.

richContent.overview: Enhanced version of the LightSheer Duet with improved ergonomics for practitioners.
richContent.howItWorks: Same 810nm diode and vacuum-assisted dual-handpiece system as the Duet. Improvements focus on handpiece design and cooling.
typicalUses: Same as LightSheer Duet: large areas and precision work
Preferred in busy practices doing back-to-back treatments
richContent.keyFeatures: Reduced practitioner fatigue during long treatment days. Same clinical efficacy as the Duet.

name: LightSheer Quattro

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: Latest in LightSheer family with four handpiece options for maximum versatility.

richContent.overview: Lumenis's most advanced diode laser with four handpiece options for maximum versatility.
richContent.howItWorks: Same proven 810nm diode with four handpieces: extra-large vacuum-assisted, large vacuum-assisted, medium, and small precision. Each optimized for specific treatment areas.
typicalUses: Extra-large: full back/legs at record speed
Small: facial hair and touch-ups
richContent.keyFeatures: Four handpiece options cover any treatment scenario in a single device. Fastest treatment speeds available in any diode laser.

name: Splendor X

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG with square spot shape for even coverage. Primarily designed for hair removal with additional capabilities.

richContent.overview: Lumenis's dual-wavelength system (755nm + 1064nm) with an innovative square spot shape for uniform coverage.
richContent.howItWorks: Unlike round spots that leave gaps or overlap, the square beam provides perfectly uniform coverage in grid patterns. Both wavelengths can be blended simultaneously or used independently. Contact cooling protects skin.
typicalUses: Large flat areas (backs, legs) where even coverage matters most
All skin types with wavelength blending for intermediate tones
richContent.keyFeatures: Square spot eliminates overlap and gaps, reducing treatment time while ensuring even results. Wavelength blending is unique to this platform.

name: Soprano ICE Platinum

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (when used with SHR delivery method)

notes: 810nm diode with SHR (Super Hair Removal) delivery method. Gradual heating approach for reduced discomfort.

richContent.overview: Alma's flagship hair removal laser using SHR (Super Hair Removal), a gradual heating approach that makes treatments virtually painless.
richContent.howItWorks: Instead of high-energy single pulses, SHR delivers rapid low-fluence pulses that gradually heat the follicle. ICE cooling keeps the skin comfortable throughout. This allows safe treatment across all skin types, including tanned skin.
typicalUses: Patients who found traditional laser too painful
All skin types including darker tones
All body areas
richContent.keyFeatures: The SHR continuous motion technique means no overlapping pulses or missed spots. Pain levels significantly lower than traditional pulsed delivery.

name: Soprano Titanium

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (tri-wavelength system)

notes: Tri-wavelength laser combining Alexandrite, diode, and Nd:YAG. SHR delivery method.

richContent.overview: Alma's most advanced platform combining three wavelengths (755nm + 810nm + 1064nm) with SHR delivery in a single handpiece.
richContent.howItWorks: Delivers all three wavelengths simultaneously: 755nm targets superficial hair, 810nm reaches mid-depth, 1064nm penetrates deepest. Combined with SHR gradual heating and ICE cooling.
typicalUses: All skin types and hair types (excluding white/gray)
Patients with mixed hair characteristics or varying skin tones across body areas
richContent.keyFeatures: Simultaneous tri-wavelength delivery is unique to this platform. Treats a wider range of hair types in fewer sessions than single-wavelength systems.

name: Harmony XL Pro

skinTypes.displayText: Varies by handpiece attachment

notes: Multi-application platform with hair removal as one of many uses. Effectiveness depends on which handpiece attachment is used. Not purpose-built for hair removal.

richContent.overview: Alma's multi-application platform supporting 15+ aesthetic treatments. Hair removal is available but not its primary focus.
richContent.howItWorks: Uses interchangeable handpiece modules. For hair removal, either 810nm diode or 1064nm Nd:YAG depending on the installed handpiece. Contact cooling protects skin.
typicalUses: Practices offering comprehensive aesthetics (skin rejuvenation, acne, pigmentation) alongside hair removal
richContent.keyFeatures: Maximum versatility across treatments, but dedicated systems like the Soprano series will outperform it for hair removal specifically.

name: Clarity II

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG with IntelliTrak technology for consistent coverage.

richContent.overview: Lutronic's dual-wavelength system (755nm + 1064nm) with IntelliTrak sensor-guided coverage technology.
richContent.howItWorks: IntelliTrak uses sensors to guide practitioners for even coverage, preventing missed areas and over-treatment. Air cooling instead of cryogen: no consumable costs.
typicalUses: All skin types with dual-wavelength flexibility
Useful for training new practitioners. IntelliTrak guides treatment
richContent.keyFeatures: IntelliTrak guidance sets it apart from other dual-wavelength platforms. Air cooling eliminates consumable costs.

name: Diolaze XL

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: 810nm diode laser with large spot size for fast treatment of large areas.

richContent.overview: InMode's dedicated 810nm diode laser built for speed. One of the largest spot sizes in any diode system.
richContent.howItWorks: Extra-large spot size delivers 810nm energy across a broad area per pulse. Sapphire contact cooling protects skin. High fluence capability for coarse hair.
typicalUses: Large body areas (backs, legs, arms) where speed matters
High-volume practices
richContent.keyFeatures: Good value compared to premium-tier devices while delivering professional-grade results. Large spot size significantly reduces treatment time.

name: Triton

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (tri-wavelength system)

notes: Tri-wavelength laser combining Alexandrite, diode, and Nd:YAG for maximum versatility.

richContent.overview: InMode's tri-wavelength platform (755nm + 810nm + 1064nm). All three wavelengths in one system.
richContent.howItWorks: Each wavelength can be used individually or combined based on patient skin type and hair characteristics. Contact cooling protects skin during treatment.
typicalUses: Clinics serving diverse populations needing wavelength flexibility
Eliminates the need for multiple laser systems
richContent.keyFeatures: Tri-wavelength capability at a lower price point than some competing systems. Significant cost savings versus purchasing separate devices.

name: Tria 4X

skinTypes.displayText: Designed for Fitzpatrick I-IV. Consult your provider for skin type assessment.

notes: Home-use diode laser. Significantly lower power than clinical devices (approximately 20 joules vs 100+ joules for clinical lasers). FDA-cleared for home use. Results require substantially more sessions than clinical treatment. It IS a real laser, but with consumer-grade power levels.

richContent.overview: One of the few true home-use laser devices. Uses an actual 810nm diode laser, not IPL like most home devices.
richContent.howItWorks: Same 810nm diode technology as professional systems but at ~20 J/cm² versus 100+ J/cm² in clinical devices. Built-in skin sensor prevents use on skin darker than Fitzpatrick IV. Small treatment window requires more time per session.
typicalUses: Maintenance between professional treatments
Small areas: upper lip, chin, underarms
Impractical for large areas due to small spot size
richContent.keyFeatures: It IS a real laser, which distinguishes it from the vast majority of home devices (which are IPL). But consumer-grade power means significantly more sessions and slower results than clinical treatment.

name: Tria Precision

skinTypes.displayText: Designed for Fitzpatrick I-IV. Consult your provider for skin type assessment.

notes: Compact home-use laser for smaller areas like face and bikini line. Same diode laser technology as Tria 4X with smaller treatment window. FDA-cleared for home use. Results require substantially more sessions than clinical treatment. It IS a real laser, but with consumer-grade power levels.

richContent.overview: Compact version of Tria's home-use diode laser, designed for smaller facial areas and bikini line.
richContent.howItWorks: Same 810nm diode laser as the Tria 4X at consumer-safe power levels. Smaller treatment window optimized for precise targeting in sensitive areas. Same skin tone sensor as the 4X.
typicalUses: Facial hair: upper lip, chin, sideburns
Bikini line maintenance
Not practical for large body areas
richContent.keyFeatures: Compact design is actually an advantage for facial precision. Same real diode laser technology as the Tria 4X.

name: Motus AX

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Moveo technology extends Alexandrite safety to darker skin)

notes: 755nm Alexandrite with proprietary Moveo in-motion technology. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics. Made in Italy by DEKA (spin-off of El.En Group).

richContent.overview: DEKA's Alexandrite laser that pioneered Moveo in-motion delivery. By gliding the sapphire-tipped handpiece continuously over the skin, it delivers energy at lower fluence per pulse with gradual heating - making treatments virtually painless while extending Alexandrite's effectiveness to darker skin tones.
richContent.howItWorks: The Moveo handpiece's sapphire tip sits flush against the skin, dramatically reducing reflected energy (traditional Alexandrite loses 50%+ to reflection). Continuous gliding motion over small areas gradually heats follicles to destruction without the sharp 'rubber band snap' of traditional pulsed delivery. This allows safe treatment of darker skin types that would normally be risky with Alexandrite.
typicalUses: All skin types including darker tones (Moveo mode)
Fine and light hair where Alexandrite excels
Patients who found traditional laser hair removal too painful
richContent.keyFeatures: Moveo technology fundamentally changed the Alexandrite hair removal experience. Near-zero pain without numbing cream. The sapphire tip's 100% energy absorption (versus ~50% loss from reflection with standard handpieces) means effective treatment at lower power settings.

name: Motus AZ+

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Moveo technology)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG with Moveo technology. Adds 1064nm Nd:YAG to the Motus AX platform for vascular treatments and expanded hair removal capabilities.

richContent.overview: Dual-wavelength upgrade to the Motus AX, adding 1064nm Nd:YAG alongside the 755nm Alexandrite. Both wavelengths benefit from Moveo in-motion delivery for pain-free treatment.
richContent.howItWorks: Same Moveo sapphire-tip technology as the Motus AX, now with the option to switch to 1064nm Nd:YAG for vascular treatments and deeper penetration on darker skin. Multiple Moveo handpiece options cover hair removal (HR), vascular lesions (VL), pigmented lesions (PL), and skin rejuvenation (SR).
typicalUses: Practices wanting both hair removal and vascular/skin treatments from one device
All skin types with dual-wavelength flexibility
Clinics prioritizing patient comfort
richContent.keyFeatures: Combines the pain-free Moveo experience with dual-wavelength versatility. Practices using the Motus AZ+ have reported significant revenue increases from the combination of pain-free marketing and expanded treatment menu.

name: Motus PRO

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Moveo + traditional delivery)

notes: Latest generation Motus platform. Adds traditional (pulsed) delivery mode alongside Moveo, plus larger 24mm spot for high-speed treatments. US distribution by Cartessa Aesthetics.

richContent.overview: DEKA's most advanced Motus platform, offering both Moveo (pain-free in-motion) and traditional (high-speed pulsed) delivery modes. The new 24mm traditional spot size increases coverage by 78% for faster large-area treatments.
richContent.howItWorks: Two delivery modes: Moveo for premium comfort-focused treatments, and Traditional for high-speed, high-volume sessions. The 24mm spot in traditional mode dramatically reduces treatment times for large areas like backs and full legs. Both modes feature integrated cooling.
typicalUses: High-volume clinics needing speed (traditional mode) and comfort (Moveo mode)
Practices wanting to offer both premium pain-free and efficient express treatments
Full treatment menu with MoveoGlo skin rejuvenation protocol
richContent.keyFeatures: Best of both worlds: pain-free Moveo delivery for patient experience, plus 24mm traditional spot for speed when throughput matters. Successor to the Motus AZ+.

name: excel HR

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Cutera's dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG. Also handles vascular lesions, pigmented lesions, and Cutera's Laser Genesis skin revitalization.

richContent.overview: Cutera's dual-wavelength hair removal system combining a high-power 755nm Alexandrite and their proven long-pulse 1064nm Nd:YAG with sapphire contact cooling.
richContent.howItWorks: The 755nm Alexandrite targets melanin efficiently for lighter skin types and finer hair, while the 1064nm Nd:YAG safely treats darker skin tones and tanned skin. Sapphire contact cooling provides constant skin protection throughout treatment.
typicalUses: All skin types with wavelength selection based on Fitzpatrick type
Clinics wanting dual-wavelength plus vascular and pigment treatment capabilities
richContent.keyFeatures: Sapphire cooling is always on (not pulsed like cryogen systems), providing continuous skin protection. Also supports Cutera's Laser Genesis skin revitalization, adding revenue streams beyond hair removal.

name: Neo Elite

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones, especially suited for darker skin (Nd:YAG with 650-microsecond technology)

notes: 1064nm Nd:YAG with unique 650-microsecond pulse technology. No cooling system, numbing, or contact gel needed. FDA-cleared for 36+ indications. Hair removal is one of many applications.

richContent.overview: Aerolase's multi-application 1064nm Nd:YAG laser using proprietary 650-microsecond pulse technology. Unique in that it requires no cooling system, no numbing cream, and no contact gel - the handpiece doesn't even touch the skin.
richContent.howItWorks: The 650-microsecond pulse duration is uniquely short, delivering high energy in brief bursts that heat the follicle while the surrounding skin's thermal relaxation time prevents damage. This eliminates the need for external cooling. The handpiece works at a distance from the skin (non-contact).
typicalUses: Practices specializing in darker skin types (Fitzpatrick IV-VI)
Multi-service clinics (36+ FDA-cleared indications including acne, rosacea, veins, rejuvenation)
Clinics wanting zero consumable costs (no cooling supplies, gels, or tips)
richContent.keyFeatures: Zero consumables and no-contact delivery mean lower operating costs. Particularly strong for diverse patient populations. Not primarily designed for hair removal - it's a versatile dermatology platform where hair removal is one of many capabilities.

name: MeDioStar

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones including tanned skin (dual diode wavelengths)

notes: German-engineered dual-wavelength diode laser (810nm + 940nm). Up to 5000W power. Distributed in the US by Astanza. Asclepion is a German company with 48+ years in the laser industry.

richContent.overview: Asclepion's flagship German-engineered diode laser, now in its 6th generation. Combines 810nm and 940nm wavelengths with up to 5000W power and the largest spot size (10 cm²) available in any diode system.
richContent.howItWorks: Blends 80% 810nm (optimal melanin absorption) with 20% 940nm (deeper penetration) for effective treatment across all skin types. TAPER fiber-bundle technology delivers a perfectly flat beam profile, eliminating hot spots. 360° Peltier contact cooling protects skin before each pulse. SmoothPulse mode enables high-frequency, low-pain treatments.
typicalUses: High-volume clinics (10 cm² Monolith XL treats full backs in ~5 minutes)
Year-round treatment including tanned skin
Practices wanting a modular system that grows with them
richContent.keyFeatures: Modular handpiece system (Monolith S, M, L, XL) lets clinics start small and expand. The 10 cm² XL spot is the largest on any diode system. German engineering with TAPER technology for perfectly uniform energy distribution. No hot spots means no striping or burns.

name: SP Dynamis

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength)

notes: Fotona's flagship multi-application Nd:YAG platform. Hair removal is one of many applications including skin rejuvenation (4D facelift), vascular, and surgical. Also available with Er:YAG for ablative treatments. Slovenian-made with 60+ years of laser manufacturing.

richContent.overview: Fotona's premium Nd:YAG platform, widely used for hair reduction alongside a broad range of aesthetic and medical applications. Known for the FRAC3® three-dimensional treatment pattern and VSP (Variable Square Pulse) technology.
richContent.howItWorks: Uses 1064nm Nd:YAG with Fotona's proprietary FRAC3® delivery, which creates a three-dimensional fractional pattern that targets hair follicles at multiple depths. VSP technology provides precisely controlled square pulses for optimal energy delivery. The optional S-11 high-performance scanner enables rapid treatment of large areas.
typicalUses: All skin types, especially effective for darker skin (Nd:YAG safety)
Multi-application practices (hair removal, 4D facelift, vascular, surgical)
Clinics wanting a premium multi-purpose platform
richContent.keyFeatures: FRAC3® targets follicles at varying depths for thorough treatment. Fotona has 60+ years of laser manufacturing heritage. Not purpose-built for hair removal, but the Nd:YAG hair removal capability is well-proven. Often paired with Er:YAG in the dual-wavelength SP Dynamis configuration.

name: Thunder MT

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Mixed Technology)

notes: Italian-engineered dual-wavelength laser with patented Quanta Mixed Technology® for simultaneous or sequential wavelength delivery. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics.

richContent.overview: Quanta System's dual-wavelength platform (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG) with their patented Mixed Technology® that allows simultaneous delivery of both wavelengths in a single pulse.
richContent.howItWorks: Two independent laser sources can fire individually or simultaneously via Mixed Technology®. Simultaneous mode combines Alexandrite's high melanin absorption with Nd:YAG's deep penetration in one pulse. The OptiScan TH scanner handpiece automatically delivers energy across wide areas with AutoMotion technology for even, low-pain treatment. Qool-air cooling system protects the skin.
typicalUses: All skin types year-round (Mixed Technology extends Alexandrite safety to darker tones)
High-speed treatment of large areas via OptiScan TH scanner
Practices wanting wavelength flexibility plus vascular and rejuvenation capabilities
richContent.keyFeatures: Mixed Technology® is unique: no other system fires both Alexandrite and Nd:YAG simultaneously. OptiScan TH scanner with super-elliptical spot shape eliminates hot spots from overlapping. Italian engineering from Quanta System (also makes surgical and urological lasers).

name: Venus Velocity

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (diode with adjustable parameters)

notes: 810nm diode laser with real-time cooling. Venus Concept is known for subscription-based equipment financing models that lower barrier to entry for clinics.

richContent.overview: Venus Concept's dedicated 810nm diode laser designed for hair removal across all skin types. Part of Venus Concept's ecosystem of aesthetic devices.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm diode wavelength targets melanin in hair follicles. Real-time contact cooling protects the epidermis. Adjustable spot sizes and parameters for different body areas and skin types.
typicalUses: All body areas for Fitzpatrick I-VI
Clinics using Venus Concept's subscription financing model
richContent.keyFeatures: Venus Concept's subscription model allows clinics to access professional equipment without large upfront investment. This has made the Velocity popular with newer practices and those expanding into laser hair removal.

name: CoolGlide

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength, especially suited for darker skin)

notes: 1064nm Nd:YAG. Originally developed by Altus Medical, acquired by Cutera. One of the earliest Nd:YAG lasers specifically marketed for hair removal on darker skin.

richContent.overview: Cutera's 1064nm Nd:YAG laser, one of the pioneering systems for safe hair removal on darker skin types. Originally developed by Altus Medical before Cutera acquisition.
richContent.howItWorks: The 1064nm Nd:YAG wavelength bypasses epidermal melanin to reach hair follicles safely on all skin types. Contact cooling protects the skin surface during treatment.
typicalUses: Darker skin types (Fitzpatrick V-VI) where other wavelengths are unsafe
Year-round treatment including tanned skin
Clinics serving diverse populations
richContent.keyFeatures: Long clinical track record for safe treatment of darker skin. The CoolGlide name became almost synonymous with Nd:YAG hair removal. Many units still in active service despite the newer excel HR being available.

name: SHR (Super Hair Removal)
whatItIs: SHR stands for Super Hair Removal. It is a delivery method, not a type of light source.
whyItMatters: SHR describes HOW energy is delivered (gradual heating with rapid pulses), not WHAT delivers it. SHR can be applied to real diode lasers (like Soprano) or to IPL machines. The term SHR alone does not tell you if you are getting a real laser treatment. You must ask what device powers the SHR - a $100,000 Soprano laser and a $3,000 generic IPL can both claim to offer SHR treatments.
askYourClinic: What is the brand and model of the device delivering SHR? Is it a Soprano laser or an IPL machine?

name: Moveo (DEKA In-Motion Technology)
whatItIs: Moveo is DEKA's proprietary in-motion delivery method for their Motus laser family. The sapphire-tipped handpiece glides continuously over the skin, delivering energy at lower fluence per pulse with gradual heating.
whyItMatters: Moveo is a delivery method exclusive to DEKA/Cartessa Motus laser systems (Motus AX, Motus AZ+, Motus PRO). Unlike SHR which can be used on any device, Moveo is hardware-specific - if a clinic says they use Moveo, they should have a genuine DEKA Motus device. The sapphire tip's flush contact reduces energy reflection from ~50% to nearly zero, meaning more energy reaches the follicle at lower power settings.
askYourClinic: What specific Motus model do you use? (Motus AX, AZ+, or PRO)

name: AFT (Advanced Fluorescence Technology)
whatItIs: AFT is Alma branded IPL technology that uses fluorescence to convert UV light to usable wavelengths.
whyItMatters: AFT is NOT a laser - it is a form of IPL. While Alma AFT technology is considered higher quality than generic IPL, it is still fundamentally an Intense Pulsed Light system, not a true laser. Results typically require more sessions than laser treatment.

name: BBL (BroadBand Light)
whatItIs: BBL is Sciton branded Intense Pulsed Light system, considered a premium IPL device.
whyItMatters: BBL is NOT a laser - it is a premium IPL system. While Sciton BBL is a high-quality device with good results for certain applications, it is fundamentally an Intense Pulsed Light system. For permanent hair reduction, true lasers typically provide faster results with fewer sessions.

name: E-Light
whatItIs: E-Light combines IPL with radiofrequency (RF) energy in a single device.
whyItMatters: E-Light is NOT a laser. It is a combination of IPL and RF technology, often marketed with impressive-sounding names. The IPL component provides light energy while RF adds heat. Despite marketing claims, this is still fundamentally an IPL-based system, not a true laser.

name: OPT (Optimal Pulse Technology)
whatItIs: OPT is a pulse delivery method used in IPL machines that provides consistent energy throughout the pulse.
whyItMatters: OPT is NOT a laser - it is a feature of some IPL machines. While OPT may improve the consistency of IPL treatments compared to traditional IPL, it is still fundamentally an Intense Pulsed Light system. The term is often used in marketing to make IPL sound more advanced.

name: DPL (Dynamic Pulse Light)
whatItIs: DPL is a marketing term for certain IPL devices, suggesting improved pulse control.
whyItMatters: DPL is NOT a laser - it is another marketing name for IPL technology. Like OPT and E-Light, DPL is used to rebrand IPL devices with technical-sounding names. Regardless of the name, these are all Intense Pulsed Light systems, not true lasers.

name: 755nm Alexandrite
whatItIs: 755nm is the wavelength of Alexandrite lasers, one of the most effective for hair removal on lighter skin tones. If your clinic uses Alexandrite, it is a real laser.
whyItMatters: When used in a true laser system, 755nm Alexandrite is gold standard for hair removal on Fitzpatrick skin types I-IV. The wavelength is well-absorbed by melanin in hair follicles. Premium devices like GentleLase and GentleMax Pro use this wavelength.
askYourClinic: What brand is your 755nm Alexandrite laser?

name: 810nm Diode
whatItIs: 810nm (sometimes listed as 808nm) is the wavelength of diode lasers, the most common type used for hair removal. If your clinic uses an 810nm diode, it is a real laser.
whyItMatters: This is critical: the wavelength alone tells you almost nothing about treatment quality. A $3,000 machine from Alibaba uses 810nm. A $100,000 LightSheer uses 810nm. Same wavelength, drastically different results. The wavelength is just physics - what matters is the power output, spot size, pulse duration, cooling system, and overall engineering quality. When a clinic says 810nm diode laser, you must ask WHAT BRAND AND MODEL. A generic 810nm diode could be an excellent clinical device or a cheap import.
askYourClinic: What brand and model of 810nm diode laser do you use? How much did the device cost? How long have you had it?

name: 1064nm Nd:YAG
whatItIs: 1064nm is the wavelength of Nd:YAG lasers, specifically designed to be safe for darker skin tones. If your clinic uses Nd:YAG, it is a real laser.
whyItMatters: 1064nm penetrates deeper into the skin and is less absorbed by melanin in the epidermis, making it safe for Fitzpatrick skin types V-VI where other wavelengths would cause burns. Premium devices like GentleYAG use this wavelength. It is also used as the second wavelength in dual-wavelength systems.
askYourClinic: What brand is your Nd:YAG laser?

name: Dual Wavelength (755nm + 1064nm)
whatItIs: Dual wavelength systems combine 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG in a single device.
whyItMatters: Dual wavelength systems offer maximum versatility, able to treat all skin types with a single machine. The 755nm treats lighter skin effectively while 1064nm handles darker skin safely. Premium examples include GentleMax Pro and Elite iQ. These are genuine lasers and considered gold standard for clinics treating diverse clientele.
askYourClinic: What brand is your dual wavelength laser?

name: Tri-Wavelength (755nm + 808nm + 1064nm)
whatItIs: Tri-wavelength systems combine 755nm Alexandrite, 808nm Diode, and 1064nm Nd:YAG in a single device.
askYourClinic: What brand is your tri-wavelength laser?

name: Quad-Wavelength (755nm + 808nm + 940nm + 1064nm)
whatItIs: Quad-wavelength systems combine four diode wavelengths (755nm, 808nm, 940nm, and 1064nm) into a single handpiece. This configuration is almost exclusively found in budget Chinese-manufactured machines, not in premium clinical systems from established manufacturers.
whyItMatters: Four wavelengths sounds like it should be better than three, but this is primarily a marketing differentiator used by Chinese OEM manufacturers to stand out from the flood of tri-wavelength machines on the market. The 940nm addition fills a minor gap between 808nm and 1064nm, but the clinical benefit over a quality tri-wavelength system is negligible. The critical issue is not the number of wavelengths. It is the quality of engineering behind them. A $3,000 quad-wavelength machine from Alibaba has four wavelengths on paper, but the power output per wavelength, pulse control precision, beam uniformity, and cooling system quality are not comparable to a $70,000 Soprano Titanium with three wavelengths. More wavelengths does not mean better results. When a clinic advertises '4-wavelength laser,' ask what brand and model they are using. If it is not from a recognized manufacturer, the extra wavelength is a spec-sheet talking point, not a clinical advantage.
askYourClinic: What is the brand and model of your 4-wavelength laser? Who manufactures it? Is it FDA-cleared?

name: IPL (Intense Pulsed Light)
whatItIs: IPL stands for Intense Pulsed Light. It uses broad-spectrum light (multiple wavelengths at once) rather than a single focused wavelength like a laser.
whyItMatters: IPL is NOT a laser. While IPL can reduce hair growth, it is a fundamentally different technology. Lasers deliver a single, concentrated wavelength that precisely targets hair follicles. IPL scatters broad-spectrum light across the skin, making it less targeted and typically requiring more sessions for comparable results. Many clinics advertise 'laser hair removal' while actually using IPL devices. Branded versions of IPL include Sciton BBL, Alma AFT, E-Light, OPT, and DPL. All are IPL regardless of their marketing names.
askYourClinic: Do you use a laser or an IPL device? What is the specific brand and model?
